config.question: Which of the following factors prompted congressional opposition to land reforms?

choices.content: absence of a viable alternative to the agricultural labor system of slavery
antipathy to the Redeemers who had emerged in the aftermath of the Civil War
desire to move from being a cotton-dependent economy to an industrial economy

answer_3.response: Consider This: Most blacks in physical possession of small farms failed to acquire title, and the mass of freedmen did not become landowners. The dream of “40 acres and a mule,” or some other arrangement that would give them control of their own land and labor, was not to be realized. Congress was conflicted over the idea of land redistribution, and President Johnson was pardoning the owners of most of the lands Sherman had once promised. See L.O. 16.2 What problems did southern society face during Reconstruction?
